data.title: Typing a space into a text field is interpreted as PgDn
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Whenever I type a space into a text field in the Settings pane, regardless of which tab I'm on, it does add a space to the field, but it also gets caught by the editor as a PgDn instruction.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open the settings pane.
2. Click on a text field.
3. Hit the spacebar.

**Expected behavior:** A space is inserted into the text field.

**Actual behavior:** A space is inserted, and the pane scrolls down as if the PgDn button had been pressed.
### Versions

This happens across both of my personal machines. My Windows 10 computer is running 1.8.0. My Manjaro (Arch fork) machine is running 1.9.0-dev-b9dbb81.

data.title: Complete documentation for Notification creation
data.body:
Notifications support several options that were yet to be documented:
`buttons`, `description`, and `stack`. Add descriptions for each option
and its defaults (where applicable, e.g. .buttons.className).

`stack` is technically available on all notification types, but it
doesn't make sense to use it on types other than 'error' and 'fatal'.
Therefore it's documented only in those two cases.

The usage and expected display, like preformatted vs. Markdown, taken
from [atom/notifications/lib/notification-element.coffee](https://github.com/atom/notifications/blob/v0.64.1/lib/notification-element.coffee).

data.title: nevermind
data.body: nevermind

data.title: Cannot Uninstall Packages and Themes on Atom 1.7.4
data.body:
Hello, Atom Community and Developers!

I decided to remove a package from Atom. When I click on the "Uninstall" button in the preferences, I receive the following error . . . 

`Failed to delete <package name>: Does not exist`

This is also happening to other packages and themes that I have installed in the editor. I am using Ubuntu 16.04.

I am wondering whether or not other people are getting the same output, and how to fix it.

Thank you in advance.

data.title: OS X: Atom can't update as a non-administrator, wastes bandwidth
data.body:
### Description

OS X El Capitan: Atom cannot update itself if you log in as a non-administrator. If you have automatic updates turned on, it will also re-download the update every few hours, wasting bandwidth.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Log in as a non-administrator on OS X.
2. Install Atom anywhere, it doesn't matter if you use `~/Applications` or `/Applications`
3. Let Atom check for updates
4. Click "Restart and install" in the About dialog.

![swzuygqf](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/769083/15906276/24eb541e-2d86-11e6-80c1-d7c44712572a.png)

**Expected behavior:** Atom should close, and a dialog should prompt you for administrator credentials if necessary. The Atom.app bundle should be replaced.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens when you click the button. If you have automatic updates turned on, Atom will also re-download the update every few hours, wasting bandwidth.

![z2040ies](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/769083/15906335/5bdec348-2d86-11e6-8b09-a59853f4999c.png)
### Other Notes

Logging in as an administrator is not a solution. It's unwise to use OS X daily as an administrator, and many IT policies forbid it. Other apps correctly prompt you to provide administrator credentials when you want to make system changes.

Putting Atom in `~/Applications` doesn't fix this issue, but it's also not a long-term solution if fixes are made. Users should be able to install Atom in `/Applications`.

The GitHub Desktop app has this exact same problem, and I've reported it to them twice. It may be an issue with ShipIt.
### Versions

```
$ atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

![ae95mneo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/769083/15906232/fe7c3f32-2d85-11e6-8f69-3589dda8b391.png)

data.title: MSI installer starts and then disappears Windows 7
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When I try installing using the MSI fir Atom 1.8 (which became available since #11087), I find that the installation starts and then disappears. No error message. See the GIF below.

![atom-msi-not-installing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167443/15906427/d540562a-2d86-11e6-932c-fef29fd72eaa.gif)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download 1.8 MSI
2. Double click to start installation.
3. Installation disappears.

**Expected behavior:** Expect the installation to start.

**Actual behavior:** Installation disappears and Atom is never installed.
### Versions

[Atom 1.8 MSI download](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/download/v1.8.0/AtomSetup.msi) on Windows 7 Enterprise.

data.title: Atom actually closes instead of hiding (which leads to a long startup time)
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Instead of hiding, Atom actually seems to close when clicking the "x" icon in the tab bar. As far as I know, this isn't how apps on OS X are supposed to behave: Generally, they just hide and show up again very fast after the Dock icon was clicked.

For example: [Here](http://d.pr/v/pTaa)'s a comparison to the Slack app. As you can see, this problem isn't occurring on their electron.js application.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Click on the "x" icon in Atom's tab bar
2. Click on Atom's Dock icon, Launchpad icon or the .app file within the Finder
### Versions

``` shell
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

``` shell
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.4
```

```
OS: Latest OS X (10.11.5)
```

data.title: Windows 10 x64 can not move file to trash
data.body: Atom version 1.8 on Windows 10 x64 "The following file couldn't be moved to trash" while deleting a file from tree view

data.title: Opening a file fails if update is ready (Mac OS X)
data.body:
### Description

If Atom is running and an update is downloaded and ready to be installed, opening a new file from an external application (like Finder) will fail - rather than opening that file in the existing application instance a new instance of the application starts up, without any files. Worse yet, after closing the second instance and restarting the initial one the update is not installed and has to be downloaded again.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install Atom 1.8.0-beta4
2. Run Atom
3. Go to Atom menu, click "Check for Update" if that menu item is present.
4. Wait for the update to be downloaded (Atom menu will show something like "Restart to install Atom 1.9.0-beta0") but don't restart Atom.
5. Run from command line: `open -a 'Atom Beta' ~/.atom/init.coffee`

**Expected behavior:** A new tab is opened in the running Atom instance, allowing to edit the Atom init script.

**Actual behavior:** A second Atom instance starts up, without any tabs. Closing that instance and restarting the initial instance won't install the update, the update has to be downloaded again instead.
### Versions

Atom 1.8.0-beta4 on Mac OS X 10.11.5. However, I've been seeing this issue at least since Atom 1.3, merely didn't realize what was causing it before now.

data.title: Fix DownloadingState typo
PHP comment code highlighting issue
data.body:
Hi,

First time posting here, please excuse any improper formatting.

I recently started using Atom for editing PHP code, and I ran into this potential issue almost immediately. When a PHP multi-line comment goes over a PHP environment tag, Atom appears to malfunction. It ignores the comment in the new PHP environment (and, in my instance, commented out all the javascript code subsequent to closing the comment as well). Additionally, all subsequent PHP code appears in italics.

I tried changing the grammar to HTML from PHP and it fixes the comment issue but, of course, the PHP code is not colored so it doesn't serve the purpose.

![atom-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4783847/15883286/a4f8d108-2cfb-11e6-8c63-4789917682ec.png)

data.title: Fix overflowing of the tabs
data.body:
This is a follow up for #11866.

In this case when there are too many tabs, they start to push `atom-workspace-axis.vertical` beyond the window width.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/490562/15840511/54e98534-2c9e-11e6-84cd-90067c05aebd.png)

Fixes https://github.com/atom/one-dark-ui/issues/138

data.title: Allow different versions of Atom to run simultaneously on Win32
data.body: Allow side-by-side versions to run rather than whichever version of Atom was launched first ends up opening all subsequent requests.

data.title: Missing scrollbars in project search on OS X in fullscreen-mode
data.body:
When I use project search (Shift+CMD+F) and get a lot of results that can be scrolled through, I see no scrollbar on the right side which means I never know at which scroll position I am nor can I make a guess how long the result set is.

Is it just me or is this a bug?

---

**Update:** I just noticed that this problem only occurs when I go fullscreen with Atom. In windowed mode I see scroll bars.

Here is a video of the issue: https://youtu.be/0P3mpwp6v6w

Using Atom 1.8.0 on OS X El Capitan 10.11.5

data.title: Words are automatically being converted to lowercase
data.body:
### Words are automatically being converted to lowercase

This first happened on Windows about a month ago - thought it was a Windows specific issue. Suddenly started happening on OS X this weekend.

It doesn't happen in Safe Mode. I uninstalled `atom-ctags` and it still happened. Disabled most of the autocomplete plugins and it still happened
### Steps to Reproduce

Think this GIF tells the story
- Basically I am trying to Capitalize a word
- As soon as I capitalize the word "Making" autocomplete seems to kick in and replace it with the lowercase version
- It seems I can make other characters uppercase - just not the first character

![](https://s3-ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com/hal-henke/GitHub/lowercase.gif)

Sorry to put this here since i know its prob a problem with some sub-package but i've tried disabling all I could think of (uninstalled `atom-ctags` as mentioned) with no change.
### Versions

OS X 10.11.5

➜  atom --version
Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
➜  apm --version
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.8.3

data.title: Developer Tools splits source files if space in user name on Windows
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

It seems that the Developer Tools has major issues determining the proper paths to files on Windows when the logged in user account has a space in their folder name. See the Actual behavior section for details.

I'm sure this bug has to have been reported before, but I couldn't find it when searching.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Log into a user with a space in their user folder name (`C:\Users\Landon Abney\`)
2. Open Developer Tools

**Expected behavior:**
All files are correctly identified to their proper location, meaning _all_ package files are identified and shown properly in the Source tree.

**Actual behavior:**

Files that are recognized as under the `file://` domain are split between `C:\Users\User Name\` and `C:\Users\User%20Name\`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/15867853/f6bb0b12-2c99-11e6-9b4b-01e6b20e9a5f.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/15867871/108ab6c8-2c9a-11e6-8b66-316d1564aab7.png)

The files under `file://C:/Users/Landon%20Abney/` also exhibit the odd behavior that the path is duplicated, but a few package's path's aren't:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/15868263/f29ca048-2c9b-11e6-87e6-27d11e8beff8.png)

While many files are only listed under the `(no domain)` categorization.

One group of these are shown as `/C:/Users/Landon%20Abney/.atom/packages/...`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/15867942/556b99f6-2c9a-11e6-814a-5b19323f585c.png)

The majority of files are shown as `C:\Users\Landon Abney\.atom\packages`:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/427137/15867998/92d16fe6-2c9a-11e6-9dca-b113a7f3e618.png)

I would expect _all_ of these files to be recognized as coming from the same folder, and shown properly in the Source tree. Often when working on a package the source file isn't listed under the `file://` domain, and I have to hunt through the huge list of `(no domain)` files, if it's even listed there.
### Versions

OS: Windows 10 x64 Enterprise

`atom --version`:

``` text
Atom    : 1.9.0-beta0
Electron: 0.37.8
Chrome  : 49.0.2623.75
Node    : 5.10.0
```

`apm --version`:

``` text
apm  1.10.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.4.windows.1
visual studio 2015
```

Note that I've seen this since before Atom hit 1.0 till current, so it's been a long standing issue.

data.title: Commenting selection comments out entire line instead of selection
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I only want to comment out a selected part of a line. When a portion of the line is selected and commented out, i would expect only that selection to be wrapped in comment tags, instead the whole line is wrapped.

![animated](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2798097/15865992/d227be7e-2c91-11e6-9121-3ead1b5cd228.gif)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Select text
2. Comment `[cmd + /]`

**Expected behavior:** To only wrap the selected text in a comment.

**Actual behavior:**  Wraps entire line in html comment
### Versions

Mac OS El Capitan 10.11.5

Atom    : 1.8.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.8.4

### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

[Description of the bug or feature]
### Steps to Reproduce
1. [First Step]
2. [Second Step]
3. [and so on...]

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Can't select or position single spaces, but only in tab size steps
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [ ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ ] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Can't select or position single spaces, but only in tab size steps
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Press tab [inserts 4 spaces]
2. Pres left arrow 2x or click with mouse after 2 spaces

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
I want the cursor to be after the second space

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
Cursor is either at position 1 or 5, but I can't go inbetween

I want to be able to insert 4 spaces with the tab key, but I don't want enforced tab grouping for navigation, I want a plain simple space-wise stepping, positioning, selecting if there are spaces. I couldn't find any option for that. I tried setting tab size to 1, but then inserting 4 tabs with tab doesn't work anymore.
### Versions

Atom 1.8.0 Debian sid

data.title: Incompatibility of soft wrapping and auto-code-completion
data.body:
Sorry I can't do a lot of cheklisting.
But this is a very simple and manifest bug, I am using 1.7.4, the bug is reproduced by:
1. turn on softwrapping
2. write to just before right edge of window
3. write a word which would trigger auto-code-completion

data.title: Toggle Comments partially comments sections of code if nested comment exists
data.body:
### Description

When highlighting a section of markup code that already contains a commented-out line, Atom's Toggle Comments feature doesn't adequately update the selection, resulting in the selection being partially commented out.  

Markup text when selected, before applying Toggle Comments: 
![screen shot 2016-06-06 at 4 32 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1813001/15838979/78bf7e02-2c06-11e6-8694-3fc74878ba7f.png)

Markup text after applying Toggle Comments:
![screen shot 2016-06-06 at 4 32 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1813001/15838997/8e347206-2c06-11e6-97ad-5e2b676090a0.png)
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Highlight a selection of markup that already has a comment.
2. Edit -> Toggle Comments (or key combo if you prefer)

**Expected behavior:** The highlighted section in it's entirety should be commented out.  

**Actual behavior:**  The selection is partially commented out.  
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.4
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
